titleStmt.title: The Scotish inquisition, or, A short account of the proceedings of the Scotish Privy-Counsel, Judiciary Court, and those commissionated by them whereby the consciences of good men have been tortured, the peace of the nation these several years past exceedingly disturbed, and multitudes of innocent people cruelly oppressed, and inhumanely murdered.

The Scotish inquisition, or, A short account of the proceedings of the Scotish Privy-Counsel, Judiciary Court, and those commissionated by them whereby the consciences of good men have been tortured, the peace of the nation these several years past exceedingly disturbed, and multitudes of innocent people cruelly oppressed, and inhumanely murdered.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and are to be sold by Richard Janeway ...,

notesStmt.note: "On the severity of the Scottish courts during the reign of James II" [i.e. James VII of Scotland]. Cf. Crawford, J.L.L. Cat. of Engl. broadsides.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
